member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager
member.summary: Provides information about folders that store presets and methods for getting Presets files for specific types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.INVALID_PRESETNAME_CHARACTERS
member.summary: Returns a string containing the characters that are invalid in a Preset name.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.#ctor
member.summary: PresetsManager Constructor

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.CreateStandardDefaultPresetValueInRegistry
member.summary: Creates the registry value which stores the file path of the default preset file, if it does not already exist. It also writes the file path of the standard default preset file to the newly created value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetStandardFolderSearchOption
member.summary: Gets the search option for the built-in Standard folder from the Registry.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetCustomFolderSearchOption
member.summary: Gets the search option for the built-in Custom folder from the Registry.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFiles(System.String,Infragistics.Win.PresetType,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsPlatform,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of PresetInfo objects for the specified 'target type name' on the specified presets platform (i.e., Win or Web)
member.remarks: This method looks for presets files in the standard folders. To find presets files in alternate folders use the overload that takes an array of DirectoryInfo or PresetInfo objects.
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The type of presets to return, i.e., Appearance or Behavior
The platform (i.e., Win or Web) that the component runs on
Specify 'true' to return files containing Custom presets or 'false' to return files containing 'Standard' presets.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFiles(System.String,Infragistics.Win.PresetType,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetFolderInfo[])
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of PresetInfo objects for the specified 'target type name' in the specified list of PresetFolderInfos.
member.remarks: This method looks for presets files in a specified list of folders represented by a list of PresetFolderInfo objects. To find presets files in the standard folders use the overload that takes the requested preset platform and an 'IsCustom' flag.
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The type of presets to return, i.e., Appearance or Behavior
An array of PresetFolderInfo objects for each folder to be searched.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFiles(System.String,Infragistics.Win.PresetType,System.IO.DirectoryInfo[])
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of PresetInfo objects for the specified 'target type name' in the specified list of DirectoryInfos.
member.remarks: This method looks for presets files in a specified list of DirectoryInfos.
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The type of presets to return, i.e., Appearance or Behavior
An array of DirectoryInfo objects for each folder to be searched.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFolderForType(System.String,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsPlatform,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a DirectoryInfo object for the specified 'target type name' on the specified presets platform (i.e., Win or Web)
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The platform (i.e., Win or Web) that the component runs on
Specify 'true' to return the folder containing Custom presets or 'false' to return the folder containing 'Standard' presets.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetUserDefinedPresetsFolders(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an array of PresetFolderInfo objects for each user defined presets folder value found in the specified registry key.
member.param: The registry key that contains the values for user defined presets folders
True to include only those folders marked as active by the user, false to include all user defined presets folders
True to include only those folders which actually exist, false to include all user defined presets folders whether they exist or not
True to remove the registry value for each folder that is returned in the list, false to leave all values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.IsDefaultPreset(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified path to a Preset file is the path to the default Preset used by the UltraGrid.
member.param: The full file path of a Preset file.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.IsPresetInStandardFolder(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetInfo,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsPlatform,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified PresetInfo is stored in the Standard folder for the specified target type.
member.param: A PresetInfo for the Preset whose location is being verified.
The platform type

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.IsPresetNameValid(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified Preset name contains valid characters.
member.param: The Preset name to evaluate

member.summary: Saves a Preset with the specified information
member.param: The control for which the Preset is being saved.
The type of the Preset.
The folder in which to save the preset
The name of the Preset
The description of the Preset
Specifies the action to be taken if a file with the same name already exists in the destination folder.
Specifies the action to be taken if a read-only file with the same name already exists in the destination folder.
Specifies whether to mark the Preset file being saved as Read Only.
True to display a message when the Preset is successfully saved.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.SetCustomFolderSearchOption(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the registry key that contains the search option for the built-in Custom folder.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.SetStandardFolderSearchOption(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the registry key that contains the search option for the built-in Standard folder.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.DefaultPresetFilePath
member.summary: Gets/sets the file path of the default Preset used by the UltraGrid. If no default Preset exists, this property returns null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.DefaultPresetFolderLiteral
member.summary: Returns the literal displayed in the user interface to represent the default preset folder.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.IsDefaultPresetValueInRegistry
member.summary: Returns true if the value for the default Preset used by the UltraGrid exists in the Registry. This will return true even if the value exists but has an empty data string associated with it.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.PresetsRegistryKey
member.summary: Returns a string representing the registry key in HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT used store information about Presets across all products.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.PresetsUserOptionsRegistryKey
member.summary: Returns a string representing the registry key in HKEY_CURRENT_USER used store information about Presets options for the current user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.TabIndexOfDefaultPreset
member.summary: Gets/sets the index of the TabPage which contains the default preset which is applied to new grids created at design-time. This property will return -1 if the default preset is the "DEFAULT" setting.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileExistsOption
member.summary: List of options for how to deal with a 'File Exists' condition when saving a Preset.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileExistsOption.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite the existing file with no prompt.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileExistsOption.Prompt
member.summary: Prompt the user to determine if the file should be overwritten

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileExistsOption.Skip
member.summary: Don't save the Preset and don't prompt.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileReadOnlyOption
member.summary: List of options for determing whether to mark a saved Preset as Read Only.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileReadOnlyOption.MakeReadOnly
member.summary: Set the ReadOnly attribute of the Preset file being saved.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileReadOnlyOption.MatchReadOnlyAttributeOfExistingFileElseNotReadOnly
member.summary: Set the ReadOnly attribute of the Preset file being saved if it is overwriting an existing Preset file and the existing file has its ReadOnly attribute set. If there is no existing PresetFile, do not set the ReadOnly attribute.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileReadOnlyOption.MatchReadOnlyAttributeOfExistingFileElseReadOnly
member.summary: Set the ReadOnly attribute of the Preset file being saved if it is overwriting an existing Preset file and the existing file has its ReadOnly attribute set. If there is no existing PresetFile, set the ReadOnly attribute.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsFileReadOnlyOption.DontMakeReadOnly
member.summary: Don't set the ReadOnly attribute of the Preset file being saved.

member.summary: Constructor

The initial value for Preset Type in the dialog
Indicates whether the presets are Win or Web presets

A string representing the registry key under HKEY_CURRRENT_USER that contains a list of registry values for each user defined folder to be searched for Presets files. The values will be automatically updated by the dialog as the user adds/removes folders.
True to show the 'Save Current Control Settings as a Preset' tab, false to hide it.
True to show the 'User Defined Presets Folders' tab, false to hide it.
